oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ed Bruce Interview by John Lomax III
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Ed Bruce by John Lomax III. The interview takes place on 6-28-82.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ed Bruce;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:01) -- John Lomax introduction. (0:11) -- John Lomax mentions Ed Bruce's several labels - Scepter, Sun, RCA, Monument, Epic, UA, and MCA. Ed Bruce mentions that he was on United Artists (UA) twice, and signed twice to RCA as a songwriter. (1:27) -- John Lomax asks Ed Bruce about how "The Last Cowboy Song" was written. Ed Bruce mentions co-writing the song with Ron Peterson at a lunch. (2:30) -- Ron Peterson wrote the chorus for "The Last Cowboy Song." Ed Bruce worked on the verses. (3:29) -- John Lomax asks Ed Bruce about working with Jack Clement at Sun Records in 1957. (5:00) -- John Lomax asks about Ed Bruce's interest in the blues. Ed Bruce mentions listening to Dewey Phillips' "Red Hot & Blue." (6:20) -- John Lomax asks Ed Bruce about why certain records he wrote did not chart. (7:40) -- Ed Bruce mentions that he did not party while in Hollywood. (9:46) -- John Lomax asks Ed Bruce about his future performance plans. Ed Bruce mentions that he's booked almost every weekend for the rest of the year. (11:04) -- John Lomax asks Ed Bruce about solo nightclub performers that he might recommend. (12:18) -- Ed Bruce recommends Ronnie Rogers. (13:18) -- John Lomax asks Ed Bruce about being compared to Don Williams. Ed Bruce responds, "I think you're comparing apples and oranges." (14:17) -- John Lomax asks Ed Bruce about working with Whitey Shafer. (16:39) -- John Lomax asks Ed Bruce how he plans on dealing with success when songwriting. (17:45) -- Ed Bruce discusses his sons and daughters.
